application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
decision_conditions: It is recommended that this Ash  tree T1 as shown on the Havering TPO plan6/78 can be overall crown reduced by up to 2m from the tip to an inter-nodal branch break to leave the tree balanced and the overhang to 3 Heath Close reduced by up to 3m to remove leaver-arm risk of lower limb growing towards property.
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out to the standards detailed in British Standard Document BS 3998:2010.
To ensure that the work is carried out in accordance with good arboricultural practice.
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out as an overall reduction, so that the tree's crown remains balanced.
To ensure that the tree's stability is maintained and in the interests of public amenity.
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out within 2 years from the date of this consent.
To prevent the accumulation of consents.

It is suggested that you engage the services of a qualified and fully insured tree surgeon to carry out the above work on your behalf (you should ask to see the contractor's insurance certificate and make sure that it is up to date).
description:
It is an Ash tree.
As advised by Tim Goldrick, Havering tree officer, prune limbs back to where they were last done. reduce height by 2 meters.
